content:
• Friday, February 8, 2013
  • NUAN

    The Street showed no mercy to Nuance (NUAN -18.5%) in response to its EPS miss and forecast for...

    The Street showed no mercy to Nuance (NUAN -18.5%) in response to its EPS miss and forecast for multiple quarters of weakness in healthcare and EMEA sales. Goldman thinks Nuance's goal of $1B in FY13 healthcare sales is now at risk, and Needham (downgrading to Hold) is concerned about guidance for a 200-250 bps FY13 gross margin drop, worse than a prior forecast. Management suggested on the earnings call it's counting on clinical documentation software sales and PC/mobile OEM deals to drive future growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM | 3 Comments

  • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: VNM +4.3%. FCG +2.3%. BNO +1.7%. UUP +1.4%. TLT +1.4%. ETF...

    The week's ETF movers - Gainers: VNM +4.3%. FCG +2.3%. BNO +1.7%. UUP +1.4%. TLT +1.4%.
    ETF Losers: FXI -4.7%. EPI -4.2%. GDXJ -3.3%. KOL -3.3%. DBA -2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM
  • RKUS

    Ruckus Wireless (RKUS +16.7%) soared over the course of the day after Motorola Mobility...

    Ruckus Wireless (RKUS +16.7%) soared over the course of the day after Motorola Mobility (NASDAQ:GOOG) disclosed a 4M-share (5.4%) stake in the service provider Wi-Fi hardware maker. Does Google, a major backer of public Wi-Fi networks, have a partnership in mind? (13G) Update: The disclosure is for an investment made by Motorola prior to Ruckus' IPO.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM | 4 Comments
  • WR

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: WR +5%. IDIX +3%. MTG +2%. GOL +2%. MTGE +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: WR +5%. IDIX +3%. MTG +2%. GOL +2%. MTGE +2%.
    After-hours top losers: MERU -3%. ROC -2%. MELI -2%. BG -2%. INFN -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • MWW

    Monster (MWW -1.7%) closed lower again today after missing Q4 revenue estimates, reporting weak...

    Monster (MWW -1.7%) closed lower again today after missing Q4 revenue estimates, reporting weak European bookings, and suggesting on its earnings call the its sale process isn't going well. "I can’t guarantee that there’s anything of interest or appropriate interest to bring to our board for presentation," said CEO Sal Iannuzzi. Oppenheimer thinks it's time for a buyback, something management has been reluctant to do. Rival LinkedIn soared today after posting a huge Q4 beat and very strong Talent Solutions sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • MELI

    MercadoLibre (MELI -2.6%) dove in afternoon trading after Venezuela devalued its currency (the...

    MercadoLibre (MELI -2.6%) dove in afternoon trading after Venezuela devalued its currency (the bolivar) by 33%. Venezuela accounted for 15% of the Latin American e-commerce giant's Q3 sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • MTGE

    American Capital Mortgage Investment (NASDAQ:MTGE): Q4 EPS of $1.40. Book value/share of $25.74,...

    American Capital Mortgage Investment (NASDAQ:MTGE): Q4 EPS of $1.40. Book value/share of $25.74, up $0.53 from Q3's end. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • CXW

    Corrections Corp. of America's (CXW -6.5%) planned conversion to a REIT has the backing of both...

    Corrections Corp. of America's (CXW -6.5%) planned conversion to a REIT has the backing of both its board and the IRS, but investors aren't so sure after the prison operator came in light on its projected $2.04-$2.16/share annual dividend. Avondale's Kevin Campbell, for example, expected ~$2.15-$2.26 - "We were already below the Street."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • MDCO

    The Medicines Company (MDCO +0.6%) says its global license and two-year collaboration with...

    The Medicines Company (MDCO +0.6%) says its global license and two-year collaboration with Bristol-Myers (BMY +1.2%) for Recothrom, a recombinant thrombin approved by the FDA as a topical hemostat to control non-arterial bleeding during surgical procedures, has become effective.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • MOH

    Molina (MOH +9.2%) powers higher today after easily topping EPS estimates yesterday, but, while...

    Molina (MOH +9.2%) powers higher today after easily topping EPS estimates yesterday, but, while results were clearly strong, Deutsche's Scott Fidel wonders how far the company has gone to account for the impact of this year's intense flu session. "The one puzzling element... was that MOH only booked $5M of incremental costs for the flu relative to last year's quarter." Fidel says. This could put pressure on its Medical Loss Ratio in the coming quarter, "particularly since most of MOH's key markets were exposed to intense levels of flu related activity in either 4Q12 or 1Q13."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • ATHN

    Athenahealth (ATHN +3.4%) moves higher after posting a mixed Q4 yesterday, beating on a per...

    Athenahealth (ATHN +3.4%) moves higher after posting a mixed Q4 yesterday, beating on a per share basis but coming up just shy on revenue. Oppenheimer's Bret Jones is cautious on the shares, saying that despite a strong pipeline, the higher growth rate in collections versus revenue could be a sign of pricing pressure. Plus, discounting on enterprise deals needs to be monitored given the increased dependence on enterprise wins.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • BIIB

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +2.6%) moves up after saying it and Swedish Orphan Biovitrum released data...

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +2.6%) moves up after saying it and Swedish Orphan Biovitrum released data that confirms the ability of its investigational recombinant factors VIII Fc fusion protein and IX Fc fusion protein to provide long-lasting protection from bleeding with fewer injections than are required with the current standard of care for people with hemophilia. Separately, Citigroup throws in the towel and ups the shares to Buy, saying the fundamentals are just too strong to look for any pullback opportunity to pick the shares up cheaper.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • TEVA

    Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA +2.3%) shrugs off a downgrade to Hold at Canaccord to trade higher...

    Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA +2.3%) shrugs off a downgrade to Hold at Canaccord to trade higher today. The company has been creeping higher since posting a less-than-stellar Q4 earnings report yesterday morning, perhaps in part due to comments during its conference call that sales of its MS drug Copaxone rose by 14% to $1.1B. Read more here: Earnings Call Transcript.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • CSL

    Carlisle Companies (CSL +2.4%) moves up after beating Q4 estimates this morning on a 7% rise in...

    Carlisle Companies (CSL +2.4%) moves up after beating Q4 estimates this morning on a 7% rise in total sales Y/Y and record income from continuing operations. Organic sales growth was 3.6%, with acquisitions in the Interconnect Technologies and Construction Materials segments contributing 3.7% to sales. Income from continuing operations rose 22% to $48.2M. EBIT margins for the year improved by 320 basis points to 11.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • WEB

    Web.com (WWWW +10.7%) soars after beating Q4 estimates. The provider of Web site/domain name...

    Web.com (WWWW +10.7%) soars after beating Q4 estimates. The provider of Web site/domain name services for SMBs guided on its earnings call for Q1 revenue ofÂ  $126.5M-$128M and EPS of $0.44-$0.46, in-line with a consensus of $127.9M and $0.45. Subscribers rose by 18K in Q4 to 3M, ARPU rose 2.1% Q/Q to $13.77, and adjusted EBITDA margin grew by 400 bps Y/Y toÂ  30%. 24.5% of the float was shorted as of Jan. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • RVBD

    For the second year in a row (previous), Riverbed (RVBD -18.3%) is cratering after providing...

    For the second year in a row (previous), Riverbed (RVBD -18.3%) is cratering after providing soft Q1 guidance to go with a Q4 beat - the departure of CTO Steven McCanne might also be taking a toll. 3 downgrades have come in - FBR and Canaccord are worried about the performance of just-acquired OPNET, as well as Riverbed's core WAN optimization hardware (up only 9% Y/Y in Q4). On the earnings call, Riverbed promised a 2H demand pickup, thanks partly to an upgrade cycle for its Steelhead WAN optimization gear.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • BDCO

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTCQX:BDCO +32%. CZR +25%. ONCY +23%. LNKD +20%. SNCR +19%. GALT +13%. ZN...

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTCQX:BDCO +32%. CZR +25%. ONCY +23%. LNKD +20%. SNCR +19%. GALT +13%. ZN +13%. FLT +12%. ZNGA +12%. ATVI +11%.
    Midday top 10 losers: ETRM -55%. MSON -22%. GUID -21%. NUAN -19%. RVBD -18%. OTC:QKLS -16%. JE -14%. NSP -13%. STS -11%. SPWR -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • SSRX

    Aegis Capital cuts 3SBio (SSRX +6%) from Buy to Hold on the back of today's announcement of...

    Aegis Capital cuts 3SBio (SSRX +6%) from Buy to Hold on the back of today's announcement of being taken private, saying that the current merger terms substantially undervalue the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • ROC

    Rockwood Holdings (ROC +6.8%) pops higher after a Bloomberg report says it is considering the...

    Rockwood Holdings (ROC +6.8%) pops higher after a Bloomberg report says it is considering the sale of its Germany-based CeramTec ceramic materials unit generating $550M in annual revenue. The unit could be valued at ~$1B based on the average multiple paid in ceramic products deals in North America and western Europe in the last five years.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (SD -2.4%) shares sink to their lowest levels since November, a drop that's...

    SandRidge Energy (SD -2.4%) shares sink to their lowest levels since November, a drop that's blamed on TPG-Axon's presentation (summary) outlining SD management's "record of massive value destruction." The company claims replacing its board, as the hedge fund suggests, would lead to a default under its credit agreement and require it to make an offer to repurchase its senior notes.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 12 Comments
  • MUX

    McEwen Mining (MUX -2%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $3.75 price target at Stifel...

    McEwen Mining (MUX -2%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $3.75 price target at Stifel Nicolaus, which says MUX is entering a period of accelerated production growth from a recent 10% increase in throughput capacity at its San Jose mine, ramping up of gold production from El Gallo Phase I, and development of both El Gallo Phase II and Gold Bar.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 2 Comments

  • Shares of Warner Chilcott (WCRX -1.3%) slip after the company issues mixed FY13 guidance as...

    Shares of Warner Chilcott (WCRX -1.3%) slip after the company issues mixed FY13 guidance as sales of its osteoporosis drug Actonel continue to weaken. It now expects total revenue of $2.3B to $2.4B, at the low end of the Street consensus of $2.38B. The company expects its cash net income per share to be in the range of $3.20 to $3.30 per share for the 2013 fiscal year. The Street view is $3.59 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • STX

    Seagate (STX +3.4%) and Western Digital (WDC +2.8%) are outperforming in the absence of major...

    Seagate (STX +3.4%) and Western Digital (WDC +2.8%) are outperforming in the absence of major news. The Fly on the Wall suggests takeover rumors are responsible for Seagate's rally. However, the company has reportedly shot down speculation it will again be taken private.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 4 Comments
  • ATVI

    Activision (ATVI +11.6%) is making multi-year highs following a Q4 beat fueled by a record 44%...

    Activision (ATVI +11.6%) is making multi-year highs following a Q4 beat fueled by a record 44% op. margin and soaring Skylanders toy sales. Sterne Agee has upgraded shares to Buy, declaring Activision well-positioned for upcoming console refreshes and predicting major buybacks are on the way. Management noted on the earnings call most of the Q4 decline in World of Warcraft subs came from China, and that Western subs were relatively stable. Electronic Arts (EA +2.2%) is higher, and so is Chinese Warcraft partner NetEase (NTES +6.7%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • GNMX

    Medgenics (MDGN -7.3%) slips after pricing its offering of company stock and warrants at $5.25,...

    Medgenics (MDGN -7.3%) slips after pricing its offering of company stock and warrants at $5.25, near current levels. The company says it's bundling the shares and warrants together, with each unit sold at $5.25 consisting of one share of common stock and a warrant to purchase one-half of a share at an initial exercise price of $6.78. The medical technology and therapeutics company said it plans to sell 5.6M shares of stock in order to raise around $29.4M. Maxim Group is acting as sole book-running manager.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • CZR

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR) pop, up 28% to add to yesterday's rally. A number...

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR) pop, up 28% to add to yesterday's rally. A number of factors are in play on the stock with online gambling teed up in New Jersey and the company announcing new moves this week like offloading assets into a partnership and lowering its debt costs. Despite the buzz, InvestorPlace warns that now is not the time to chase shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • CFN

    CareFusion (CFN +2.3%) moves higher after beating on its FQ2 result late yesterday. The company...

    CareFusion (CFN +2.3%) moves higher after beating on its FQ2 result late yesterday. The company reported Q2 EPS of $0.54 versus $0.44 estimated by the Street, on revenue of $909M, in line with estimates. Total sales were up 8% Y/Y, while net earnings rose 14% on strength in its smaller procedural-solutions business. The medical-equipment company also provided its postponed first-quarter financial report, with profit up 20%. Read more on earnings here: Earnings Call Transcript.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • TECK

    Teck Resources (TCK -2.3%) CEO Don Lindsay said in yesterday's conference call that values...

    Teck Resources (TCK -2.3%) CEOÂ Don Lindsay said in yesterday's conference call that values have come down and more assets have come available for potential M&A, including projects in the iron ore sector which TCK has been eager to break into for years. TCK has more than $3.2B of cash on its balance sheet, but Lindsay stressed it would do nothing to threaten its investment-grade credit rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • SPWR

    Some solar stocks are off after SunPower (SPWR -6.9%) provided light top-line guidance to go...

    Some solar stocks are off after SunPower (SPWR -6.9%) provided light top-line guidance to go with its Q4 beat. FSLR -2.4%. YGE -2%. STP -2%. TSL -1.9%. SunPower's EMEA sales fell 64% Y/Y in Q4, nearly offsetting solid growth in the Americas and Asia-Pac. However, gross margin rose 460 bps Q/Q to 18.6%. Continued margin improvement and an expected 10% drop in opex lead SunPower to predict on its earnings call it will see a "significant increase" in EPS this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • FLT

    FleetCor Technologies (FLT +12.5%) jumps after its Q4 easily topped estimates yesterday. The...

    FleetCor Technologies (FLT +12.5%) jumps after its Q4 easily topped estimates yesterday. The company reported an EPS of $0.82, beating Street estimates of $0.75, on revenue of $185M. Net earnings jumped 59% Y/Y as the commercial-fuel-cards company reported double-digit revenue gains globally, as well as stronger margins. The company also offered upbeat guidance for the full year, now expecting to earn between $3.61 and $3.69 a share, topping the $3.40 per share estimate by analysts, on revenue between $790M to $810M, versus the Street's expectation of $776M. Read more on earnings here: Earnings Call Transcript.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • VECO

    LED/hard drive equipment maker Veeco (VECO -2.1%) slides after reporting its Q4 bookings totaled...

    LED/hard drive equipment maker Veeco (VECO -2.1%) slides after reporting its Q4 bookings totaled $92.3M, +10% Q/Q but -37% Y/Y. The company, whose full Q4 results are on hold thanks to an accounting review, added it doesn't "see any clear signs" LED industry overcapacity and weak end-market demand for hard drives will improve in the near-term. Moreover, "competitive pricing pressure" exists in the LED equipment space. AIXG -1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD +19.7%) is off to the races as accolades pour in following its huge Q4 beat, and...

    LinkedIn (LNKD +19.7%) is off to the races as accolades pour in following its huge Q4 beat, and is lifting some recent Internet IPOs along the way. YELP +5.6%. GRPN +2.7%. ZNGA +4.2%. "LinkedIn remains one of the best business models online today," writes Cantor, impressed with 106% Y/Y international growth but maintaining a Hold on valuation grounds. LinkedIn stated on its earnings call it plans a "mid-single-digit" price increase for its recruiting product. 2,400 Talent Solutions customers were added in Q4, raising the total base to 16.4K organizations.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • SSRX

    3SBio (SSRX +7.2%) agrees to be taken private by Decade Sunshine in a deal valuing the...

    3SBio (SSRX +7.2%) agrees to be taken private by Decade Sunshine in a deal valuing the China-based biotech at ~$350M. SSRX shareholders will get $2.20/share in cash, or $15.40 per ADS.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +5%) opens higher after catching a two-notch upgrade to Overweight from...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +5%) opens higher after catching a two-notch upgrade to Overweight from Morgan Stanley. MS is pleased with ALU's refinancing deal and restructuring efforts, and thinks competition between telecom equipment firms is cooling off, but remains worried about the margin impact of unprofitable service contracts. Investors took profits yesterday following the company's Q4 report and CEO announcement. (Q4 results: I, II) (Nokia Siemens report)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 2 Comments
  • SNE

    Shares of Sony (NYSE:SNE) open weak following another tough trading day in Japan. During the...

    Shares of Sony (NYSE:SNE) open weak following another tough trading day in Japan. During the last quarter, the company made money in its movie, music, and financial services businesses but investors are focusing on the losses bled out from electronics and mobile phones units. Today, the Xperia Z smartphone debuts in Japan to much fanfare in what is a critical Sony product launch.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • JE

    Just Energy (JE -15.4%) shares plunge at the open after the utility adopts a shareholder rights...

    Just Energy (JE -15.4%) shares plunge at the open after the utility adopts a shareholder rights plan. The company also released FQ3 earnings of $0.28/share vs. a $0.70/share loss in the year-ago period. Cuts its dividend to C$0.07/month from C$10.33. Other highlights: energy customer additions of 341K, up 10% Y/Y; customer base growth to 4.3M, up 11% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 2 Comments
  • AOL

    More on AOL: A new $100M stock buyback has been authorized. Ad sales +13% Y/Y, a pickup in...

    More on AOL: A new $100M stock buyback has been authorized. Ad sales +13% Y/Y, a pickup in growth from Q3's +7%. A 31% increase in 3rd-party network ad sales, and a 17% increase in search ads, offset flat display ad sales for AOL properties. Dial-up ISP revenue again fell 10% - 99K domestic subs were lost Q/Q, but ARPU rose $0.80 to $19.27, and churn held steady at 1.8%. Free cash flow was $46.3M, -36% Y/Y. The Membership Group (includes ISP ops) still makes up vast majority of profits. AOL +8.9%. (PR) (slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM

  • At the open: Dow -0.3% to 13944. S&P -0.18% to 1509. Nasdaq -0.11% to 3165. Treasurys:...

    At the open: Dow -0.3% to 13944. S&P -0.18% to 1509. Nasdaq -0.11% to 3165.
    Treasurys: 30-year +0.11%. 10-yr +0.06%. 5-yr +0.04%.
    Commodities: Crude +0.22% to $96.04. Gold -0.24% to $1667.25.
    Currencies: Euro -0.22% vs. dollar. Yen -1.09%. Pound -0.63%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM
  • TARO

    Taro Pharmaceutical (NYSE:TARO) and Sun Pharmaceutical mutually agree to terminate their merger...

    Taro Pharmaceutical (NYSE:TARO) and Sun Pharmaceutical mutually agree to terminate their merger agreement in which Sun - a 66% owner of Taro - would have paid $39.50 for the rest of the company (Taro closed at $50.55 last night). SA author Retail Investor has covered the saga here and here, and thinks Taro could be a triple. Shares +0.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • ONCY

    Oncolytics Biotech (NASDAQ:ONCY) +35.3% premarket after announcing positive results from a...

    Oncolytics Biotech (NASDAQ:ONCY) +35.3% premarket after announcing positive results from a mid-stage clinical trial examining the use of its lead product candidate Reolysin in helping shrink tumors. ONCY says 95% of patients with squamous cell carcinoma of the lung using Reolysin intravenously in combination with carboplatin and paclitaxel exhibited overall tumor shrinkage.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • FXC

    Canada has a big miss on January jobs, losing 21.9K vs. expectations of a 5K gain. The...

    Canada has a big miss on January jobs, losing 21.9K vs. expectations of a 5K gain. The unemployment rate drops to 7% vs. 7.2% expected, as the number of those looking for work declined. The loonie (FXC -0.3%) dives, now below parity with the greenback at $0.9971.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) is losing even more market share to Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) than what has...

    Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) is losing even more market share to Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) than what has been previously forecast is the logical conclusion that comes from taking in the quarterly reports (CSTR, NFLX) of both companies, according to JPMorgan's Paul Coster. The company is still banking on its video streaming service - currently in a beta - to swing the momentum back in its direction, but the clock is ticking. CSTR -7.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • OCRX

    Drugmaker Tranzyme (TZYM) +11.7% premarket on news it will explore a possible sale of the...

    Drugmaker Tranzyme (TZYM) +11.7% premarket on news it will explore a possible sale of the company, less than two years after it went public. Two mid-stage trials of its development drug for stomach paralysis recently were dropped due to lack of efficacy.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • LPX

    Louisiana-Pacific (NYSE:LPX): Q4 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $458.7M beats by $15M....

    Louisiana-Pacific (NYSE:LPX): Q4 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $458.7M beats by $15M. Shares +3.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • MCD

    More on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD): Comparable store sales in Europe are still soft, shedding 2% in...

    More on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD): Comparable store sales in Europe are still soft, shedding 2% in January, but Asia is the driver behind the headline drop in global sales. Continuing deterioration in Japan and the chicken contamination scare in China both contributed to the malaise in the region. With analysts already calling for a 1.1% drop, and many of the Asian headwinds transitory, the report isn't a shocker. MCD -0.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • APO

    More on Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO) Q4 earnings: This just in - private equity is...

    More on Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO) Q4 earnings: This just in - private equity is working really well right now (see Blackstone, see Fortress, see KKR). Carried interest of $959M in Q4 was about double that of last year. "I don't want to use words like 'records,' but there were records," says a giddy exec. Shares +3.8% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM
  • MCO

    More on Moody's (NYSE:MCO) Q4 earnings: 2013 EPS guidance of $3.45-$3.55 vs. consensus of $3.18....

    More on Moody's (NYSE:MCO) Q4 earnings: 2013 EPS guidance of $3.45-$3.55 vs. consensus of $3.18. Adjusted operating margin of 46-47%. Share repurchases of $500M, largely to offset employee stock-compensation plans. After a nice pop, shares back to flat premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM
  • RSH

    RadioShack (NYSE:RSH) board chairman Daniel Feehan says the retailer named Joseph Magnacca as...

    RadioShack (NYSE:RSH) board chairman Daniel Feehan says the retailer named Joseph Magnacca as its new CEO to be a catalyst for change. So far, investors see a sliver of light for the company after the hire. RSH +6.1% premarket to $3.30.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM

  • Japanese Finance Minister Taro Aso has said that the yen's sharp drop since November has been...

    Japanese Finance Minister Taro Aso has said that the yen's sharp drop since November has been too fast. "The yen's sudden move from 78 or 79 to 90 was not something we anticipated," Aso said. His comments come amid international criticism of the falling yen and talk of "currency wars," and might be a sop ahead of a G20 meeting next week. Following the remarks, the yen is +1.2% vs the dollar at 92.464.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 AM

  • Strong Chinese trade data and falling inflation help send Asian and European shares higher. "The...

    Strong Chinese trade data and falling inflation help send Asian and European shares higher. "The Chinese economy is gathering momentum, but at the same time inflation remains well contained," says economist Savanth Sebastian. "Effectively, this is the sweet spot." However, Japanese shares skid following disappointing earnings from Sony and other heavyweights. Japan -1.8%, Hong Kong +0.2%, China +0.6%, India -0.1%. EU Stoxx 50 +0.7%, London +0.6%, Paris +0.6%, Frankfurt +0.4%, Milan +0.4%, Madrid +0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 AM
